body.p: An entity can make a reliable estimate of its legal or constructive obligation under a profit‑sharing or bonus plan when, and only when:

li.p: the formal terms of the plan contain a formula for determining the amount of the benefit;
the entity determines the amounts to be paid before the financial statements are authorised for issue ; or
past practice gives clear evidence of the amount of the entity’s constructive obligation.
